chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Triasia Latrice McGee-Mitjans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 7/01/2016 along with payment plan fee of $15.00. Alternate 30 days jail, consecutive for non payment.

Restitution of $801.78 to Robert K. to be paid joint and several with co-defendant Jeremy Crumb. Surcharges of 5% and 10% are added to restitution. To be paid on payment plan with fine and costs. Restitution to be paid first.
07/12/16 NOTICE FROM DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE, RESTITUTION PAID.

DNA and Blood costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Blood draw costs will be forwarded to the City of Muskego Police Dept, once they are paid.

With Huber.
Standard release conditions. 
COMMENCE by 6/06/16 by 5PM.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle  TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Attend Victim Impact Panel by 6/22/2016 for 20 days huber, consecutive as alternate.
Follow through with Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

To be completed within 1 year.
Monitored by WCS.

records.addlTxt:
For Non-Appearance.
Upon detention defendant to serve 20 days of Jail w/huber (all standard release condtions) as a penalty for non-completion of community service hours.
Court will allow good time credit to be applied.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Triasia Latrice McGee-Mitjans not in court. 
Case scheduled for 1:30 pm. and Matter called @ 4:35 pm.
Court was to address:  Completion/Non-Completion of Community Service Hours.

As of the last court date the defendant still had to complet all 50 hours of community service.
As of today's date no verification of community has been filed with the court.
Therefore, court orders a warrant be issued.
Upon detention defendant to serve 20 days of Jail w/huber (all standard release condtions) as a penalty for non-completion of community service hours.
Court will allow good time credit to be applied.
Review hearing on April 12, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Defendant Triasia Latrice McGee-Mitjans in court, by zoom.
Court to Address:  Active Warrant For Non-Complietion of Community Service Hours.

Defendant presented statements to the court.
Defendant still needs to complete her 50 hours of community service.
Court will give the defendant an additional 6 months to complete the community service or as a penalty for non-completion 20 days jail w/huber.
If the defendant provides verification to WCS of completion of the community service the next court date can be removed from the calendar.
  Review hearing scheduled for April 12, 2021 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 1, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Triasia Latrice McGee-Mitjans in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts #1, #3 and #4 are dismissed and read in. 

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 2:

HUBER:  15 days, w/Standard Release Conditions. Defendant to report to Huber facility by 5:00 p.m. on 6/6/16 .

FINE: $1229.00 (to pay $50.00 per month commencing 7/1/16 or serve 30 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment of fine. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Muskego Police Department. (to be paid as part of payment plan on fine/costs).

D/L REVOCATION: 13 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 13 months;

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 50 Hours within 1 year from today's date. To be monitored through WCS.

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  6/22/16. Defendant to serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

RESTITUTION: $801.78 to Robert K. to be paid joint and several with co-defendant Jeremy Crumb. (to pay $50.00 per month commencing 7/1/16 - restitution to be paid before costs/fines).

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
